Thanks

Alex

Hi Alex,

I'm fixing the root cause of this now, but it's still going to look incorrect if it's using the paralympic logo. That logo's bigger than the other hub page logos, because it has text that needs to be legible. It looks fine on the hub pages that have a photo, rather than text, there (f'rexample. the Get Involved hub - http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/index.php). The smaller logos fit under the text. The attached screenshots should show what I mean.

Marna

Confused, as it was working before. The picture, text etc on that page
hasn't changed at all.... And the logo has always been that one...

Hi Marna

 

It's ok, have worked out what the issue was here. Debs changed the logo
from Olympic to Paralympic in the metadata so it didn't have any text
underneath it before hence why it looks strange now!

 

She's going to change it back.


Thanks anyway

 

Alex

From: Marna Gilligan [mailto:notifications-support@postcms.zendesk.com] 
Sent: 14 October 2009 12:30
To: Alexandra Brown
Subject: [PostCMS support] Re: Homepage won't publish
What time did you publish those, and the homepage, can you remember?

Hi Alex,

Not sure if what you are describing as (Homepage won't publish) is actually to do with Video on the home page (as the home page does seem to be publishing, but with a broken video)

If it is, read on... (else ignore me!)

Videos on the home page now need to be added  as a two stage process

i) create a video page for your video via the video screen (in the cms) http://london2012.kitsite.com/kit/files/video/
ii) then assign the url of that page in the home page eg. news/video/the-best-of-us.php

The reason for this two step process, is that by creating a video page we have
a) a single resource (ie. a page) for every video in the system
b) can then create various size thumbnails for this video (important on the new site)
c) can send a single url (the video age) to stamen
d) are ready for when a video supplier comes on board (in that we can automate the process of video pages being created and therefore you being able to select them in the cms)

I agree the way you select videos on the home page is less than ideal, one idea we had for the redesigned site is to base it on tags ie. you tag a video a #homepage (on the video page) and the latest 8 videos with that tag are automatically pulled though.

But currently, to get the new video live,

1) create a new page for it via the interface http://london2012.kitsite.com/kit/files/video/
2) paste the path tot hat page (start with news/video) into the top box on the home page.

Hope that makes sense

Jamie

The webcams look good to me now; http://www.london2012.com/plans/olympic-park/webcams/index.php 

Is that looking ok to you?

Yes, fixed the problem, thanks!

 

________________________________

comments.value: In the context of creating a video thumbnail, using an existing image interferes with the workflow, so we wanted to put a warning in the screen not to reuse existing images. Any way of doing that (or switching off "Change picture")?
Wouldn't it be better to fix the workflow? That's client-specific code already.
Lars, I have assigned this back to you in the hope that fixing the workflow will not be too hard to do.
With the new resize functions there should be a new solution to this problem... but as the video sections is probably going to be changed completely we should look at this later.

subject: Is it possible to add annotations to image widgets?
description: In the context of creating a video thumbnail, using an existing image interferes with the workflow, so we wanted to put a warning in the screen not to reuse existing images. Any way of doing that (or switching off "Change picture")?

comments.value: With the result that you get broken images displaying on the site home page and image hub.
Need a better description, have tested on live and seems to work?

I think the fix here is that any "Image section" code that displays images (like the home page) needs to look for "Image pages" and then from those pages find the related thumbnail.

It shouldn't be driven by image thumbnails but by Image pages (I think in the redesign we need to click though to the actual image page, so it will need to work like this for the redesign anyway) 

The danger on relying on images is that there may be cases where we want to delete an image page but leave the thumbnails (ie. if the thumbnail is used on news)

Those promos should list image pages not thumbnails.

In other words:

All image pages have a thumbnails
All images (thumbnail) do not necessarily have to have an Image page (it just so happens most do)

I think we should always pull image-pages. 

What if we restrict deleting anything in photos/resized and only allow deteting image pages which leads to a cleaner version of this?
Hey, what's the status of this?
new workflow should fix this.

subject: Deleting image asset does not expire Image pages
description: With the result that you get broken images displaying on the site home page and image hub.

comments.value: What are the steps required to reject an uploaded image that has previously been approved (i.e. in error)?
We have changed the workflow on images and this should be implemented.

subject: 2012: Image upload. Deleting a page.
description: What are the steps required to reject an uploaded image that has previously been approved (i.e. in error)?

I haven't been able to reproduce recently either.  If it happens again, I'll let you know immediately.
new website, new seach style

Er, incorrect. Autocomplete is by and large working, and working in 
the same way as it always has. I can send you six or seven screenshots 
if you're interested, but recommend you just try typing into any of 
the other metadata inputs on that same screen: Location, Organisation, 
Theme, etc.

It looks to me as if the hot fix we shipped yesterday in response to 
the problem you were having with renaming tags has introduced a new 
bug in the page editor tag autocomplete. This is the problem with 
shipping fixes in a hurry, of course. You'd think we'd know better by 
now! However, answers your second question: it will be rolled out when 
it's ready.

Regards
Michael

But it IS broken for all the free text tagging. Which means that people
will create new free text tags which won't relate to any of our previous
tags. Which is rather a bummer. I can send you quite a few screenshots
of that, too. :-)

Sadly, I'm not sure "when it's ready" is going to make many people very
happy. Can you at least give an approximation? "Tomorrow", "Next
week", "Next month"? For the new site we're going to be creating (and
tagging) lots of new pages. We'll need it for that.

Thanks


Liz Goulding
New Media Producer
London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games
Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297
Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000
www.london2012.com

Er, incorrect. Autocomplete is by and large working, and working in 
the same way as it always has. I can send you six or seven screenshots 
if you're interested, but recommend you just try typing into any of 
the other metadata inputs on that same screen: Location, Organisation, 
Theme, etc.

It looks to me as if the hot fix we shipped yesterday in response to 
the problem you were having with renaming tags has introduced a new 
bug in the page editor tag autocomplete. This is the problem with 
shipping fixes in a hurry, of course. You'd think we'd know better by 
now! However, answers your second question: it will be rolled out when 
it's ready.

Regards
Michael

comments.value: Any progress with this yet?

Yes. K has done his bit; you can route to a specific page in zendesk with a path like postcms.com/kit/support/path/to/zendesk/page. In the CMS js layer you can override kit.HELP_URL to specify which url that should be. 

Still to do is to be able to write a per-screen help url into the app config xml. We need to do it like that because some of the "custom" screens that (eg) 2012 use are not custom screens at all, just path-filtered generic screens (eg. Getty feed). I haven't done this yet because, well, it's rather tricky. In fact, I'll probably palm it off on K (but not before he's finished some other more impt stuff!).
Could I have a quick update on this? I am quite keen to start hooking up custom help screens for 2012.

It's pending a bundle. But that is unlikely to happen before the end of the week, and maybe not till next week. That's because we've had to commit various updates that aren't production-ready yet in order to avoid conflicts (amazing how much difference one more person working in the codebase makes!)

In app.xml, you can add a help attribute to a custom screen like this:
<screen name="opportunities" label="Future opportunities" plugin="opps" help="/kit/support/forums/61175/entries/52691"/>
So, get the URL from zendesk, and substitute /kit/support for the postcms.zendesk.com bit - this will deal with single signon. 

For native screens, the help url will probably need to be hard-coded in the JSP - let me know if any of these are urgent.

subject: Specify the help page from within a PostCMS screen
description: Any progress with this yet?
